pr_title: Add catalog name and deserializer class name to split information

timeline.bodyText: I think some connectors return null when we invoke getInfo
timeline.author: Praveen2112

replies.bodyText: yeah, that failed some tests. wrapping it in an optional now.
replies.author: phd3

replies.bodyText: will the optional be rendered the right way  in query JSON?
replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: this has been removed now based on Martin's suggestion.
replies.author: phd3

timeline.bodyText: This should be a field in SplitCompletedEvent, instead.
timeline.author: martint

replies.bodyText: Modified. I've added it to SplitOperatorInfo as well, so that it's accessible during SplitCompletedEvent creation. Getting catalog name from a "stats" object is a bit indirect, but I felt that this is the simpler, even though there's redundancy. otherwise, we could pass the optional catalog from SqlTaskExecution#enqueueDriverSplitRunner. wdyt?
replies.author: phd3

timeline.message:
Add deserializer class name to HiveSplit#getInfo

This value is useful for tracking the file format of hive splits scanned.

Add catalog name to SplitCompletedEvent

The catalog name is useful for attributing scanned splits
to the respective catalogs.

Add catalog name to SplitCompletedEvent

The catalog name is useful for attributing scanned splits
to the respective catalogs.
